mission-sheet.name: ART - Target acquisition - Detect indirect fires

italic.text: The systematic observation of aerospace, surface or subsurface areas, places, persons, or things, by visual, aural, electronic, photographic, or other means. To provide continuous view, and the potential for reports on the activity of an objective

line.text: In this sword mission, to move to a given position in order to detect indirect fire in the given area.
Lines used by units to adapt their behavior when they reach or cross them.
Right or left boundaries inside which the agent performs the mission.
Right or left boundaries inside which the agent performs the mission.
The position onto which the agent deploys.

The agent moves toward the given position. If the position is not reachable (an urban block inside which the agent cannot move, for instance), the agent moves as close as possible, else it moves to the center of the position. Average speed depends on the physical capabilities and terrain properties.

Upon reaching the position, the agent deploys to it. The delay of deployment depends on the data defined in the authoring tool (see the "Units" tab, "Deployment" section). Upon deployment termination the report "section deployed" should be displayed.
Upon deployment termination, the agent activates its capability of observing indirect fire.
When an indirect fire is observed in the area , the report "idirect fire spotted" is displayed.
If no position is issued the agent stays at its current position.
The mission ends if another mission (or "the cancel maneuver" fragmentary order) is issued by user.
